name: Dominic Williams
description: Dominic Williams is the founder and chief scientist of the DFINITY Foundation, pioneering the development of the Internet Computer.

name: DFINITY Foundation
description: The DFINITY Foundation is a non-profit research organization based in Zurich, Switzerland, focused on building the Internet Computer.

name: Internet Computer
description: The Internet Computer is a decentralized computing platform powered by blockchain technology, enabling the creation of scalable, secure web applications.

name: Canister
description: Canisters are smart contracts that run on the Internet Computer, allowing developers to create decentralized applications (dApps).

name: ICP
description: ICP is the native utility token of the Internet Computer network, used for governance, computation, and network transactions.

name: Motoko
description: Motoko is a programming language specifically designed for building applications on the Internet Computer blockchain.

name: Chain Key Technology
description: Chain Key Technology is the cryptographic breakthrough enabling the Internet Computer to scale to millions of nodes with seamless upgrades.

name: NNS
description: The Network Nervous System (NNS) is the autonomous governance system that manages the Internet Computer and its network upgrades.

name: Neuron
description: A Neuron is a governance entity on the NNS, allowing users to vote on proposals and earn rewards for their participation.

name: Genesis Block
description: The Genesis Block marks the official launch of the Internet Computer network in May 2021, ushering in a new era of decentralized computing.

name: WebAssembly
description: WebAssembly (Wasm) is a low-level binary instruction format used by the Internet Computer to execute canister smart contracts efficiently.

name: Threshold Relay
description: Threshold Relay is a consensus mechanism used by the Internet Computer to ensure high-speed transaction processing across the network.

name: ICP Holders
description: ICP holders participate in the governance of the Internet Computer by staking their tokens and voting on network proposals.

name: DFINITY ICP Utility
description: ICP tokens are used to pay for network transactions, deploy canisters, and participate in the governance of the Internet Computer.

name: Subnet
description: Subnets are independent blockchain networks within the Internet Computer that handle smart contract execution and scale the system.

name: DFINITY SDK
description: The DFINITY SDK is a set of tools and libraries that developers use to build, test, and deploy applications on the Internet Computer.

name: Cycles
description: Cycles are the fuel used to power canisters on the Internet Computer, allowing developers to run decentralized applications.

name: Decentralized Finance
description: Decentralized Finance (DeFi) refers to financial applications built on blockchain technology, such as lending and trading, now possible on the Internet Computer.

name: ICP Governance
description: ICP governance is a decentralized process where stakeholders submit and vote on proposals that shape the development of the Internet Computer.

name: Internet Identity
description: Internet Identity is a privacy-preserving authentication framework that allows users to securely log into dApps on the Internet Computer.

name: Smart Contracts
description: Smart contracts on the Internet Computer are executed in canisters, enabling trustless, programmable transactions and logic on the blockchain.

name: Scaling
description: The Internet Computer's architecture allows for unlimited scalability by adding new subnets, supporting mass adoption and global applications.

name: Quantum-safe Cryptography
description: Quantum-safe cryptography ensures that the Internet Computer remains secure even in the face of future quantum computing advancements.

name: DFINITY Roadmap
description: The DFINITY roadmap outlines the future development milestones of the Internet Computer, focusing on scalability, governance, and ecosystem growth.

name: Cycle Wallet
description: A Cycle Wallet holds cycles, which are used to power canisters on the Internet Computer and maintain the execution of dApps.

name: Web 3.0
description: Web 3.0 is the next generation of the internet, driven by decentralized technologies like the Internet Computer to enable a user-controlled web.

name: ICP Staking
description: Staking ICP allows users to lock their tokens in neurons, participate in governance, and earn rewards for voting on proposals.

name: Open Internet Services
description: Open Internet Services are decentralized applications and platforms built on the Internet Computer, offering users control and ownership of their data.

name: Reverse Gas Model
description: The Reverse Gas Model in the Internet Computer allows users to interact with dApps without paying gas fees directly, as developers cover the costs.

name: WebGPU
description: WebGPU is a new graphics API supported by the Internet Computer, allowing for the development of high-performance, graphics-intensive dApps.
